faculty_name: Faculty of Allied Health Science (School of Nursing)
note: The School of Nursing is dedicated to training compassionate and competent nursing professionals.
The program combines theoretical knowledge with extensive clinical practice in accredited healthcare facilities.

fees: Ghanaian Students : GHC 22,000 - GHC 26,000 per year
mode: In-person classroom lectures, clinical skills laboratory, and hospital-based clinical rotations
Integration of theory and practice with supervised patient care
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Core Mathematics, and Integrated Science
WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in Biology, Chemistry, and Physics or Elective Mathematics
Competitive selection with aggregate typically 18 or better
level_note: Comprehensive nursing education accredited by the Nursing and Midwifery Council of Ghana.
Students develop clinical competencies in various nursing specialties through rotations.

note: The School of Pharmacy trains pharmaceutical professionals committed to healthcare excellence.
The Doctor of Pharmacy program meets international standards for pharmaceutical education.

fees: Ghanaian Students : GHC 28,000 - GHC 34,000 per year
mode: In-person lectures, laboratory practicals, and clinical pharmacy rotations
Hands-on experience in hospital and community pharmacy settings
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Core Mathematics, and Integrated Science
WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in Chemistry, Biology, Physics, and Elective Mathematics
Highly competitive aggregate typically 8 or better
level_note: Rigorous 6-year program preparing pharmacists for professional practice and licensure.
Includes theoretical pharmacy sciences, pharmaceutical chemistry, and clinical practice.

note: The School of Medicine is committed to training physicians of high caliber with excellent clinical skills.
The MB ChB program is recognized internationally and meets Ghana Medical and Dental Council standards.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MB ChB)

fees: Ghanaian Students : GHC 35,000 - GHC 45,000 per year
mode: Classroom lectures, laboratory sessions, and extensive clinical rounds in teaching hospitals
Supervised patient care and surgical observation
entry_requirements: WASSCE: A1-C6 passes in English Language, Core Mathematics, and Integrated Science
WASSCE: A1-C6 passes in Chemistry, Biology, and Physics
Highly competitive aggregate typically 5 or better
level_note: Comprehensive 6-year medical program recognized by international medical bodies.
Strong emphasis on clinical competence, ethics, and community health.

note: The School of Dentistry prepares dental professionals to deliver excellent oral healthcare.
The BDS program is accredited and meets standards for dental education and practice.

fees: Ghanaian Students : GHC 32,000 - GHC 40,000 per year
mode: In-person lectures, dental laboratory practicals, and clinical dentistry in the teaching clinic
Supervised patient care in oral health services
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Core Mathematics, and Integrated Science
WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in Chemistry, Biology, and Physics
level_note: 5-year program in dental science and clinical practice recognized by dental regulatory bodies.
Covers oral biology, prosthetics, restorative dentistry, and surgical procedures.
